Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

Rest API main¶

main.read_root()¶

The read_root function is a GET request that returns the root of the API. It will return a JSON object with one key, ‘messege’, and its value will be a string containing information about this API.

Returns:

A dictionary with the key ‘message’ and value ‘contact api’

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, such as connecting to databases or initializing caches.

Returns:

A dictionary with the following structure

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API database db¶

src.database.db.get_db()¶

The get_db function is a context manager that will automatically close the database session at the end of a request. It also handles any exceptions that occur during the request, rolling back any changes to the database if an exception occurs.

Returns:

A database session, which is used for querying the database

Doc-author:

Trelent

username¶
src.database.models.updated_favorites(mapper, conn, target)¶

The updated_favorites function is a listener that listens for the ‘after_insert’ event. When this event occurs, it checks to see if the first name of the target (the object being inserted) is in our family list. If so, it sets favorites to True.

Parameters:

  • mapper – Access the mapper object that is used to map the class to a table

  • conn – Get a connection to the database

  • target – Access the row object

Returns:

The target object

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session)¶
The create function creates a new contact in the database.
Args:

body (ContactModel): The contact to create. user (User): The current user, used for authorization purposes.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact object from the database based on the user’s id and the contact’s id. The function takes in three parameters:

-contact_id: an integer representing the unique identifier of a specific contact. -user: an object representing a user that is logged into our application. This parameter is used to ensure that only contacts belonging to this particular user are returned by this function. -db: an SQLAlchemy Session instance, which represents our connection to the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact that we want to retrieve

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, user: User, db: Session, first_name, last_name, email)¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

The function takes in three parameters: limit, offset, and user. Limit is an integer that specifies how many contacts to return at once. Offset is an integer that specifies where to start returning contacts from (for pagination). User is a User object containing information about the current logged-in user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning results

  • user – User: Get the user_id of the logged-in user

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • first_name – Filter the contacts by first name

  • last_name – Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – Filter the contacts by email

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_upcoming_birthdays(limit: int, offset: int, user: User, db: Session)¶
The get_upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts whose birthdays are within the next week.
Args:

limit (int): The maximum number of items to return. offset (int): The number of items to skip before returning results. user (User): A User object representing the current user making this request. This is used for authorization purposes, as only contacts belonging to this user will be returned in the response body.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned by the query

  • offset – int: Determine how many contacts to skip before returning the results

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts that have birthdays in the next week

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶
The remove function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. user (User): The user who is removing the contact. db (Session): A connection to our database, used for querying and updating data.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact to be deleted

  • user – User: Get the user id of the current logged-in user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session)¶
The update function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactModel): The updated information for the specified contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact we want to update

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the data from the request body into this function

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged-in

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository User¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object to be created. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy session object used for querying the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Pass in the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

The new user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass the email address of a user into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object, or none if the user doesn’t exist

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: avatar link

  • db – Session: Pass the database session into the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_password(user: User, hashed_password: str, db: Session)¶

The update_password function takes in a user object, a hashed password string, and the database session. It then updates the user’s password to be equal to the hashed_password string. Finally it commits this change and refreshes the database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • hashed_password – str: Pass the hashed password to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The user object with the updated password

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Specify the user to update

  • refresh_token – str | None: Specify that the refresh_token parameter is a string or none

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database and if they have already confirmed their email. If not, then we update their record in our database with a confirmation of their email.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed or a message that the email has been confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.forgot_password(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The forgot_password function is used to send a reset password email to the user.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A message that tells the user to check their email for a reset password link

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session from the dependency injection container

Returns:

A jwt and a refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If the user’s current refresh_token does not match what was passed into this function then it will return an error.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.reset_password(request: Request, new_password: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), confirm_password: str = Form(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The reset_password function is used to reset a user’s password.

It takes in the new_password and confirm_password as form data, then hashes the new password and updates it in the database.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the token from the url

  • new_password – str: Get the new password from the user

  • confirm_password – str: Confirm that the user has entered their new password correctly

  • db – Session: Get access to the database

Returns:

A dictionary with message, new_password and confirm_password keys

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.reset_password_template(request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The reset_password_template function is used to render the reset_password.html template, which allows a user to change their password after they have requested a password reset. The function takes in the token that was sent to them via email and uses it to retrieve their email address from the database. It then uses this email address to find their username and display it on the page.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the request object

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A html page with a form to reset the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. If the email address already exists in the database, an HTTP 409 error is raised. The password field of the UserModel object is hashed A new user record with all fields except for password (which was hashed) are created and returned to the caller.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

Returns:

A dictionary, which returns massage about successful user creation

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.verify_by_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The verify_by_email function is used to verify a user’s email address.

It takes in the user’s email address and sends them an email with a link that they can click on to confirm their account. The function also checks if the user has already confirmed their account, and returns an error message if so.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

:param : Get the user’s email address from the database :return: A message to the user :doc-author: Trelent

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

  • db – Session: Get the database session

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function is a GET request that returns the contact with the given ID. The function takes in an integer as a path parameter, and uses it to query for the contact. If no such contact exists, then an HTTP 404 error is returned.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(first_name: str | None = None, last_name: str | None = None, email: str | None = None, limit: int | None = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • first_name – Annotated[str | None: Validate the first_name parameter

  • last_name – Annotated[str | None: Specify the type of data that is expected

  • email – Annotated[str | None: Validate the email address

  • limit – Optional[int]: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first n records

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of all contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_by_upcoming_birthdays(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts_by_upcoming_birthdays function returns a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Set the limit of contacts returned

  • le – Limit the number of contacts that can be returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the path parameter in the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the user that is currently logged in

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id, body and db as parameters. It returns a ContactModel object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the contact model

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – User: Get the user who is logged in

Returns:

A contact model

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Pass the current user to the function

Returns:

The current user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function is used to update the avatar of a user.

The function takes in an UploadFile object, which contains the file that will be uploaded to Cloudinary. It also takes in a User object, which is obtained from auth_service’s get_current_user function. Finally it takes in a Session object, which is obtained from get_db().

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session from the dependency injection

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API services Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds,

the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 400 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A byte string

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which uses the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM to create an encoded string. The data dictionary contains information about the user’s email address, as well as when it was issued (iat) and when it expires (exp). The iat and exp values are added to the data dict before encoding.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the data passed to it

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which is 7 days in seconds.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A refresh token that is encoded with the user’s id,

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token from the request body

Returns:

The email of the user that is stored in the refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, or raises an exception otherwise.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Create a connection to the database

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to return the email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email address that was used to create the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Specify the password that will be hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • plain_password – Check if the password entered by the user matches the hashed_password

  • hashed_password – Compare the password that is passed in from the user to the hashed password stored in our database

Returns:

A boolean

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API services Email¶

async src.services.email.send_reset_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_reset_email function sends a password reset email to the user.
Args:

email (str): The user’s email address. username (str): The username of the user requesting a password reset. host (str): The hostname of the server sending this request.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the user who is requesting a password reset

  • username – str: Get the username of the user who is trying to reset their password

  • host – str: Create a link to the reset password page

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.services.email.send_verification_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_verification_email function sends an email to the user with a link that they can click on to verify their email address. The function takes in three parameters:

  1. An EmailStr object representing the user’s email address. This is used as both the recipient of the verification message and as part of a token that will be sent to them, which will allow us to verify their identity when they click on it.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the user

  • username – str: Get the username of the user

  • host – str: Pass the host url to the template

Returns:

The token_verification

Doc-author:

Trelent
